It does not involve cGMP as the second messenger.

Option B: Angiotensin II- This option is incorrect. Angiotensin II primarily acts through the angiotensin II type 1 receptor (AT1 receptor) and utilizes the inositol trisphosphate (IP3) and diacylglycerol (DAG) signaling pathway, leading to an increase in intracellular calcium levels. It does not involve cGMP as the second messenger.

Option C: ADH (antidiuretic hormone, also known as vasopressin)- ADH acts through the V2 receptor and utilizes the cAMP signaling pathway, activating protein kinase A (PKA) and regulating water reabsorption in the kidneys. It does not involve cGMP as the second messenger.

questions.text: Which of the following options best represents 'very severe COPD' according to the GOLD criteria?
questions.solution:
Correct Option A - FEV1/FVC <0.7 and FEV1<30%:

  • The Gold's criteria for very severe COPD is: FEV1/FVC <0.7 and FEV1 <30%
  • GOLD Classification for COPD:

Mild COPD

FEV1/ FVC<0.7

FEV1≥80%

Moderate COPD

FEV1/ FVC <0.7

FEV1 = 50-80%

Severe COPD

FEV1/ FVC <0.7

FEV1 = 30-50%

Very sever COPD

FEV1/ FVC <0.7

FEV1 <30%

Incorrect Options:

  • Options B, C and D are incorrect.

questions.text: Who is classified as a category III non-heart-beating donor?

choices.text: A patient who died after failed resuscitation after reaching the hospital
A patient who was bought dead to the hospital
A patient who is awaiting cardiac arrest in the hospital

questions.solution:
Correct Option D - A patient who is awaiting cardiac arrest in the hospital:

  • This refers to a patient who is in a critical condition and expected to die imminently within the hospital setting. These patients may have conditions such as end-stage organ failure, irreversible brain damage, or severe trauma that cannot be treated successfully. They are kept under palliative care until their natural death occurs, at which point their organs may be considered for donation.

Incorrect Options:

Option A - Dead on arrival: This is a category 1 donor.

Option B - A patient who died after failed resuscitation after reaching the hospital: This is a category 2 donor. In this case, resuscitation efforts were attempted upon the patient's arrival at the hospital but were unsuccessful. While this patient did experience cardiac arrest, they would not fall under the category of no-heart-beating donor as resuscitation attempts were made.

Option C - A patient who was bought dead to the hospital: If a patient is brought dead to the hospital, it means they were already deceased upon arrival. Similar to the first option, this patient would not meet the criteria for no-heart-beating donation.

questions.text: Which of the following conditions is linked to AV block?
questions.solution:
Correct Option A - Hypothyroidism:

  • Hypothyroidism, a condition characterized by an underactive thyroid gland and reduced production of thyroid hormones, is known to be associated with AV block. The exact mechanism is not fully understood, but it is believed that the low levels of thyroid hormones can have direct effects on the electrical conduction system of the heart, leading to disturbances in the conduction pathway and potentially resulting in AV block.

Incorrect Options:

  • Options B, C and D are not associated with AV block.

questions.text: What medication is employed for mass chemoprophylaxis in the case of meningococcal meningitis?
questions.solution:
Correct Option A - Ciprofloxacin:

  • Ciprofloxacin is a broad-spectrum antibiotic that is effective against Neisseria meningitidis. It is the drug of choice for mass chemoprophylaxis in individuals who have been in close contact with a person diagnosed with meningococcal meningitis.
  • Ciprofloxacin is effective in eradicating the bacteria from the nasopharynx, reducing the risk of transmission.
  • Ciprofloxacin is contraindicated in 1st trimester of pregnancy, hence ceftriaxone is given.

Incorrect Options:

Option B- Chloramphenicol: Chloramphenicol can be used for the treatment of meningococcal meningitis, it is not the preferred choice for mass chemoprophylaxis.

Option C- Tetracycline: Tetracycline is not the drug of choice for mass chemoprophylaxis..

Option D- Penicillin: Penicillin is effective against many strains of Neisseria meningitidis, but it is not a preferred drug for mass prophylaxis.

questions.text: Nasopharyngeal chordoma arises from which of the following?
questions.solution:
Correct Option B - Notochord: 

  • Nasopharyngeal chordoma is a rare type of malignant neoplasm from remnants of the notochord.
  • Patients usually present with complaints of headache and cranial nerve palsies due to intracranial spread, nasal obstruction with discharge, epistaxis, and dysphagia in those with pharyngeal spread.
  • Slow growth rate of the tumor, which gradually fills the nasopharyngeal cavity leads to delayed oncological diagnosis.

 

Incorrect Options:

Option A - Pharyngeal bursa: Pharyngeal bursa is located in the midline of the posterior wall of the nasopharynx in the adenoid mass. PHARYNGEAL BURSITIS is an infection of the pharyngeal bursa which is a median recess representing attachment of notochord to endoderm of the primitive pharynx.

Option C - Rathke's pouch: It is represented clinically by a dimple above the adenoids and is reminiscent of the buccal mucosal invagination, to form the anterior lobe of pituitary. A craniopharyngioma may arise from it.

Option D - Luschka's bursa: Pouch of Luschka: During development, notochord is attached to the endoderm in the area of nasopharynx producing an invagination pouch. Persistence of this pouch causes Thornwaldt's cyst which may get infected to form an abscess.
